Posts.Content: bromero wrote: I have been reading most of the topics, but having trouble finding someone with similar symptoms.  First, I am 49 and sadly I have never felt confident in doing a self breast exam.  So after reading a lot of info on this site, I starting being conscientious.  I had a biopsy 2 years ago, (not a lump, but a mass that showed up on the mammogram).  The surgeon said the biopsy revealed an inflamed lymphnode on my chest wall, which was very hard to get to during biopsy--wow--the pain of that experience was enough to make me run away from any future testing.  But recently, I have discovered lump in the lower outside portion of my left breast, but what really has me concerned is the pea-sized knots i'm feeling all the way up by chest wall and underneath my arm pit.  I was under the assumption that you were not supposed to be able to feel lymphnodes. I already have 2 strikes against me in that I had a hysterectomy @ age 32 and have been on harmone replacement for 18 years.  If there is anyone else who has had this type of experience, please, please post something.  I do have an appointment with the surgeon who did my biopsy on Monday, but not being able to sleep or eat--need info. Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2008 09:03AM bromero wrote: Thank you so much for the pep-post.  I tried to keep really busy this weekend with my girls.  My appointment is today @ 2:00, and I have my list of questions ready for the doctor.  He is a wonderful surgeon who specializes in breast disease, so I have the utmost respect & confidence in him.  These blog sites are so wonderful, filled with so many courageous women who have gone through many trials.  I appreciate the input and will post an update.  I hope he will be able to schedule a digital mammogram immediately. God Bless, Beryl
